eventInfoList.dialogueText: I can hardly believe it... you're almost as tall as your old man, @.
Starting high school next year, even! Just as I was getting used to you being a middle schooler.
I'm proud of you. I have no doubt you'll crush it out there.
Though it does probably mean less time with me and your mother, eh? You've been out of the house a lot lately.
But I understand. I was a teenager once too! Yeah, ancient history, I know.
The older you get, the more you want to do things your way - to go out and live your own life.
...Enjoy it. As much as you can.
But be wary. Not everyone out there is like your mother and I, or your teachers and friends at school.
There are some bad people out there. Don't trust everyone you meet. Eyes open at all times, you hear?
I guess what I'm trying to say, @, is to be strong when you're out there on your own. Don't let anyone screw you over.
How's that for a morning pep talk?
I'll stop lecturing you now - I've gotta go to work! I'll see you around, @, take care of yourself.
